question_1.question: What is the default Row Scan Depth value when setting up a connection to a local Excel file?
question_1.explanation: The default Row Scan Depth value is set to 100. This means the provider will read only the first 100 rows to decide the data types.

question_2.question: Which authentication scheme is required when connecting to a SharePoint file through the Microsoft Excel Online provider?
question_2.explanation: OAuth is the required authentication scheme when using the Microsoft Excel Online provider to connect to a SharePoint file.

question_3.question: When connecting to an Excel file stored in Azure Blob storage, what should the URI field format be?
question_3.explanation: The correct format for the URI field when connecting to an Excel file in Azure Blob storage is 'azureblob://mycontainer/myblob/file.xlsx'.

question_4.question: What is the purpose of setting up an app registration when connecting to an Excel file through Microsoft Excel Online?

options.option_a: To create a new Excel file
options.option_b: To generate a unique file identifier
options.option_d: To set up a data source name

question_4.explanation: Setting up an app registration is necessary to establish OAuth credentials, which are required for authentication when connecting to an Excel file through Microsoft Excel Online.

question_5.question: What does setting the Row Scan Depth to 0 imply when connecting to a local Excel file?

options.option_a: Only the first row will be scanned to determine data types.
options.option_b: Only the first 100 rows will be scanned to determine data types.
options.option_c: The whole file will be read before deciding on the fields' data types.
options.option_d: No rows will be scanned and data types must be set manually.

question_5.explanation: Setting the Row Scan Depth to 0 means the provider will read the entire file before deciding on the fields' data types.

question_6.question: When connecting to a SharePoint file on a specific site, what information is required in the Storage Base URL field?

options.option_a: The path to the Documents folder
options.option_b: The SharePoint URL to the specific site
options.option_c: The local path where the file is stored
options.option_d: The URI of the Excel file

question_6.explanation: The Storage Base URL field requires the SharePoint URL to the specific site when connecting to a SharePoint file on that site.
